channel.title: Barrows help
channel.description: How do i make it so when u dig on the hill at barrows it takes you to the underground tunnel?

what would i do if i dont have public boolean CheckForSkillUse3(int Item, int Slot) {

item.title: Barrows help
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

I Don’t take credit for this so no bullshit about leeching please.
Difficulty: 4/10
Server Source: any
File’s Modified: Client.java, npchandler.java, item.java, autospawn.cfg
Purpose: To make Barrows very close to runescape’s.

This is only posted by me. If you see it any where other then here and runeserver it is leeched.

Ok so the first thing we need to do is put the Barrows brothers in there tombs. So open up Autospawn.cfg and add this to it.
//Start Of Barrows //
1 2 3 4 5
spawn = 2026 3551 9713 -1 0 0 0 0 1 Dharok
spawn = 2030 3571 9706 -1 0 0 0 0 1 Verac
spawn = 2029 3573 9688 -1 0 0 0 0 1 Torag
spawn = 2025 3553 9696 -1 0 0 0 0 1 Ahrim
spawn = 2028 3552 9679 -1 0 0 0 0 1 Karil
spawn = 2027 3542 9702 -1 0 0 0 0 1 Guthan
//*End Of Barrows //

What is this doing. Well the firs line is merely stating what it is(// will cancel out cancel and code past it that is on the same line). I have put a number over all the details I will be talking about.

  1. Is the ID of the NPC
  2. Is the X coordinate of the NPC
  3. The Y coordinate of the NPC
  4. The height level of the npc
    and
    5)Meerly a description of the NPC(anything can go there)

I will only be making the barrows for one of the brothers. For all the others it will be generally the same idea you just need to change some numbers and names.

Now we can work on making it so when you dig you go to the tomb.
First off find
public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
You can declare any sort of method(boolean, void, int, string, long ect.) as long as it is below this line and not in a other method.

So lets start off by declaring this.
public boolean veracTomb() {
if((absX >= 3553) || (absX <= 3559) || (absY >= 3301) || (absY <= 3294) ||
heightLevel > 0)
return true;
else
return false;
}
Now lets disect this shall we?
Public booean VeracTomb(){
Very simple this is just the method we are declaring.
if((absX >= 3553) || (absX <= 3559) || (absY >= 3301) || (absY <= 3294) ||
heightLevel > 0)
This part is a little bit harder. This is showing what area we are going to consider the area above verac’s tomb.

The first absX is the North West coordinate
the second absX is the South East corner
absY of the North West
the second absY should be self explanitory.

So what we want to do is get the choords using that format around Verac’s hill thing. Use the void I posted as your base and it will work for veracs hill.

The next step is making is so when you dig on the tomb you will go inside. The previous step is what is going to allow us to do this.

Search for
public boolean CheckForSkillUse3(int Item, int Slot) {
This is where you will put item use options.

The ID for dig is 952 so under
switch (item){
add
case 952:
if(veracTomb == true){
teleportToX = 3571;
teleportToY = 9706;
hightLevel = 1;
}
break;

Yea! but wait a moment? what if I want to go to the Dharoks tomb? for this we need a else if statement. What it does is it checks the first if statement(if veracTomb == true) and if it is false it moves on to the next one. So it would then look like
case 952:
if(veracTomb == true){
teleportToX = 3571;
teleportToY = 9706;
hightLevel = 1;
} else if(dharokTomb ==true){
teleportToX = x coord;
teleportToY = y coord;
hightLevel = 1;
break;

Simply add a else if statement for all the other brothers like with what I did.

Now we need to make it so when they kill all 6 brothers they get the reward. We could use keys but those are boring! So we will do it just based on the kills. First thing is we are going to need a interface to pop up when you go throught the portal or whatever your way to get there is. So declare this.

barrowsPanel = false;

public int verackillCount = 0;
public int dhkillCount = 0;
public int toragkillCount = 0;
public int guthankillCount = 0;
public int ahrimkillCount = 0;
public int karilkillCount = 0;
public void writebarrows() {

if(barrowsPanel) {
setInterfaceWalkable(15892);
} else if(!barrowsPanel) {
setInterfaceWalkable(-1);
}

sendQuest(“Barrows”, 15894); //Title

//Left hand side
sendQuest("Verac: "+verackillCount, 15895);
sendQuest("Dharok: "+dhkillCount, 15897);
sendQuest(“Ahrim”+ahrimkillCount, 15898);
sendQuest(“Karil”+karilkillCount, 15899);
sendQuest(“Torag”+toragkillCount, 15900);
sendQuest(“Guthan”+guthankillCount, 15901);

//Right hand side
sendQuest("", 15896);
sendQuest("", 15902);
sendQuest("", 15903);
sendQuest("", 15904);
sendQuest("", 15905);
sendQuest("", 15906);
}

Now we need to set it so when you go to barrows that pops up so simply add
writebarrows()
under however you plan to have people get there.

We will be skipping a step so we can stay in client.java for now.

First add the object 6774 where ever you want.

Where you add object first clicks add this
case 6774:
if(verackillCount = 1 && dhkillCount = 1 && arhimkillCount = 1 && karilkillCount = 1 && toragkillCount = 1 && guthankillCount = 1){
sendMessage(“you open the chest and recieve your reward”)
sendMessage(“thank Pilldom for this awsome new barrows”)
addItem(Item.randomBarrows(), 1)
} else {
sendMessage(“You need to kill all the brothers before you can open the chest”)
}
break;

The next step is to make it so when you kill a barrows brother he gives you the kill counter. for this go to Npchandler.java.
search for
npcs[i].animUpdateRequired = true;

Under this add
else if (npcs[i].npcType == 2303 && npcs[i].NeedRespawn == false) {
npcs[i].actionTimer = 0;
client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[GetNpcKiller(i)];
c.verackillCount += 1;
}
Add this for all the brothers but change the ID and the verackillcount. Now the last thing to do is set the reward from the chest

Head over to item.java. Add
Public static int Barrows[] =(put item id of the rewards you want);
then under that add
public static int randomBarrows()
{
return Barrows[(int)(Math.random()*Barrows.length)];
}

Save and compile and you have close to runescape barrows. CONGRATZ!!!

Credits 100%-ME

If you want to say that I leeched this give me proof cause I want to see it.

NOTE: This is untested if the first person who trys this could tell me if it works.
THANK YOU.

This should cover all ur barrows coding questions —James—

Read full topic
